intro: Cucumis serotinus, commonly known as the late cucumber, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes other cucurbits like cucumbers and melons. The plant produces small, pale green fruits that are typically harvested when fully mature. Its botanical features include trailing stems with hairy leaves and yellow flowers. It is often cultivated for its edible fruit, which has a mild flavor and is used in various culinary applications.
